p:Text.v: A theory stating that the level of investment is determined by the ratio of the stock-market valuation of the physical capital of firms and the current replacement cost of those items. Investment will rise if the former is greater than latter and vice versa. First suggested by James Tobin (1918- ), the theory provides an improvement on both the accelerator theory (which is theoretically weak) and the user-cost-of-capital theory (which is weak in practice).
